website_summaries.verdict: If you work in a construction site or other rugged environment, you'll appreciate the durability of this label maker.
pros: Earns praise for its rugged and durable construction, including molded rubber bumpers for added protection
cons: Some consumers find themselves struggling to read the secondary keys in lower light settings

customer_reviews.title: NO BATTERY!
customer_reviews.text: So, I have only taken the unit out of the package, and I am disappointed by the fact that the Amazon website implied that this unit ships with the Li-ion battery because it doesn't ship with any batteries. The only way to get the Li-ion battery is to purchase it separately from Brady ($85) or buy the BMP21-PLUS kit for and addition $100. The kit does include a charger which would be the only way possible to charge the battery, so you probably should not buy the battery unless you buy the charger too.
customer_reviews.author: Nascarfan2448988

customer_reviews.title: this printer is great. Prints labels and bar codes perfectly
customer_reviews.text: If you deal with cabling, this printer is great. Prints labels and bar codes perfectly. There is a wide variety of label material available and there isn't any waste of label material when printing (the old Brother unit I was using wasted a lot of label material as it had large blocks of blank label material on each side of the printing. This printer is much more efficient with the label materials.)
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Amazing. Use it every day.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great label maker (BMP 21-Plus). It is very versatile. The cartridges are a bit confusing and getting the right one isn't the easiest. I mostly use Black on White Vinyl (M21-500-595-WT) which is a basic white label with black text, and Black on White Self Lam Vinyl (M21-1500427) which I use to label cables and wires.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Just one annoying omission
customer_reviews.text: The label printer works well and is easy to print labels. The only annoying omission is the lack of a dedicated SHIFT key to quickly switch between upper and lower case. To change case you have to hold the bottom left key, then press the CAPS feature key which changes the case. So to capitalize the first letter of a word or include upper and lower case letters on your labels is a cumbersome task.
customer_reviews.author: Abi

customer_reviews.title: Different font style from my other BMP21.  Unacceptable
customer_reviews.text: I am extremely pissed about this bmp21 labeler. I have the EXACT same model which is two years older and the unchangeable stock programmed FONT TYPE is completely different from one machine to the next. Consistency is important in my field and the new font style is horrible....Almost unreadable. I’ve always bought Brady labelers because of their dependability, but this is infuriating...right before a huge job. What do you have to say about this Brady?
customer_reviews.author: Will T

customer_reviews.title: Missing some basic stuff
customer_reviews.text: I like the printed labels - nothing is better - but the printer has a couple of problems. It eats batteries. The keyboard layout should be QWERTY. It has some rather exotic symbols, but is missing ≥ and ≤ .. You will want to buy an aftermarket power adapter. It is the labels that make this great - yes they are pricey - about $2/300mm[ft] but there is nothing better for labeling wires(vinyl stuff) - the nylon labels for places it needs to last.. I've used several other label systems over the years - impressed with this - just who thought the keyboard made sense?
customer_reviews.author: Karl

customer_reviews.title: Nice printer but firmware not updateable.
customer_reviews.text: The BRADY BMP21-PLUS is a very nice label printer. However, this model cannot have its firmware updated. Download of the latest Owner's Manual from BRADY shows firmware version 2.3 was available in 2019. Contacted BRADY and told printer's splash screen firmware version 2.0 = manual's 2.3 = provided release notes 2.29.88608 are equivalent. Buyers just might want to spend the extra $10 and buy direct from the BRADY web site. That way your BMP21-PLUS will be guaranteed to have the most current firmware installed; well worth the extra few bucks!!
customer_reviews.author: P. R.. Fectionist

customer_reviews.title: $97 after taxes and can't be used out of the box...
customer_reviews.text: OK, it's my fault for not spending a little more time and reading several reviews instead of trusting that an almost $100.00 labeler would come packaged with 6 AA batteries in order to be used right out of the box. There are two description on this website about this product and both talk about the batteries the item uses, however neither state that they're not included!! I ordered this labeler as an exchange for another a Brother's labeler that was too big for work. I thought: "Well! From 40 something dollars to 100 bucks! Heck! It's gonna make them labels through telepathy!! AND ONE WOULD BE DEAD WRONG! No batteries and no chargers either. Seriously Brady!!??
customer_reviews.author: Edwin P.

customer_reviews.title: Save you Money this Printer is a Lemon
customer_reviews.text: Unit produces poor quality labels right out of the box . Its skips half of the label like a printer with a clogged head. It failed to accept Brady Labels that are the correct labels for this machine. Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.author: CNCMILL

customer_reviews.title: Just get this one and be done with it.
customer_reviews.text: This is the label printer you need if you ever intend to wire labels or patch panels. Don't be fooled by the lower cost of some competitors and lower label costs. You get what you pay for and this label printer is a great value on Amazon. Other budget printers will waste a LOT of label so the lower cost will eventually exceed just buying this bad boy in the first place. Most of the other labelers that claim to do wire, actually only do "tags" which is a mess and not what any electrician would find acceptable.
customer_reviews.author: Nylox

customer_reviews.title: Horrible design or faulty device
customer_reviews.text: There is no physical off switch, so it often gets turned on when stashed away. Every few days that this is used it needs new batteries even if it didn't print any labels, and the backlight settings are set to never turn on. So it must be a faulty device because without any functions or lights on it shouldn't be completely eating 6-AA batteries in 4 days. Additionally if you try to print a 3/4" long label for a wire, it will only print at the very top, not repeating down throughout, which is just bad design.
customer_reviews.author: Brian D. Westerhof

customer_reviews.title: Great Labeler, poor battery life
customer_reviews.text: We have several of these label makers at my work. the label maker works great, but spend the money for the rechargeable battery, we have two of these units with replaceable batteries. I put batteries in it when I purchased it and a week later I went to use it for the first time and the batteries were dead. one of my co-workers has the same problem with his. Now I pull 1 battery out when I'm not using it so that they don't get drained between uses.
customer_reviews.author: Bob C

customer_reviews.title: You'll spend 10x the cost of the unit on labels!
customer_reviews.text: Unit itself is not bad. Rugged. What is frustrating is: 1) Cost of materials. Nobody except for Brady makes the label tape and it is EXPENSIVE. Compare to Brother tape and all of the decent 3rd party alternatives. 2) Batteries die in the unit if left unused for a couple weeks. I've switched to Brother PTD600, tapes are 1/3 of the price, more variety, a lot more functions on the printer itself and advanced PC software allow you to easily create just about any type of label, template, print 100s of labels with serial numbers, etc...
customer_reviews.author: Boris

customer_reviews.title: Perfect printer for electrical wiring
customer_reviews.text: Perfect printer for electrical wiring, lasts a long time on a set of batteries. Comes with a 3/4" printer cartridge, print is very clear and doesn't smug after print out. The tape is very easy to remove the sticker. The cartridges come in many different sizes and colors plus you only need one cartridge not like the old printers where you have to buy the black tape and the white sticker tape. I like the rubber cover, feels good in your hands. I am very happy with this printer.
customer_reviews.author: William A Lehne JR

customer_reviews.title: Better off with the BMP41 Label Printer
customer_reviews.text: I have used Brady productions professionally for 20 years. I got this for personal use, and regret it. I would highly recommend spending the extra money in the near term for the BMP41 Label Printer. In the long run, you'll use much less tape and get much more functionality. Otherwise, the product is well built and there are no quality issues. The rechargeable battery is also recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Kirchner

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Don't know why I kept buying cheaper brands without the functionality and versatility of this one. This thing is great. There are various kits, but I purchased everything separately (this, rechargeable battery, power cord, magnetic adapter and a hard case) and it was a little cheaper than the kits I saw. Will be buying another one, so I can keep one in my office and one in my work truck.
customer_reviews.author: Michael E.

customer_reviews.title: Worked for one day.
customer_reviews.text: The first day I had this unit, it worked like a charm. After day one, there seemed to be a problem with the unit. It would seem starved for electrical power. My unit did not come with the AC adapter, and I was using batteries. The batteries would not stay in the proper configuration in their compartment. When I would attempt to print something, the unit would cut out and the resulting label would be incomplete. Tried changing the batteries several time, and the same result. Hope to return this unit for one that works.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Alderman

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: I don't understand how this labeler got such good reviews. This is my third and last Brady labeler. You're lucky if it lasts a year. The labels are expensive and you end up throwing half of them away because the machine thinks the spool is empty, or the labels misfeed. There must be a better system, and I intend to find it.
customer_reviews.author: Boofus D

customer_reviews.title: Forces you to have a wide margin on the ends
customer_reviews.text: The reason I gave this 3 stars is because it forces you to have these giant margins on the ends. If you try to use fixed width, the text ends up just being smaller. It ends up being a massive wast of labels which already cost so much. This printer feels very old and clunky. It works, it makes words on sticky things but the menus feel like something from the 90s.
customer_reviews.author: rainbowdasher

customer_reviews.title: Versatile for indoor and outdoor
customer_reviews.text: I am making labels on labels. Marking vegetable and fruit trees on a pop sickle type stick with a sharpie pen. Exposed to the elements the sharpie ink is no longer legible after 2 or 3 months. Labels made with this Brady stick to the sticks or other marker and remain legible. Buy the AC adapter. It's just easier. However, the battery option is also useful.
customer_reviews.author: Everglades

customer_reviews.title: Use this at work every day
customer_reviews.text: The labels are the most durable available, stick to everything you put it on, and great for wire markers. As an electronics tech in a harsh printing industry environment, I was happy to buy a second one for home use.
customer_reviews.author: R. Seward

customer_reviews.title: lithium batteries cause malfunctions
customer_reviews.text: I've come to discover that lithium batteries cause this device to act erratically. Often, it doesn't print, it skips, or it only partially prints. I've wasted a lot of money on expensive shrink tubing to discover this... No warning in the instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Chase

customer_reviews.title: Works good till it doesn't.
customer_reviews.text: These are very expensive considering they do not last very long. If you leave the head closed and store it the mechanism stretches and will not print. Brady customer service leaves something to be desired as well.
customer_reviews.author: Tmx1911

customer_reviews.title: Top shelf, high quality, more than you will ever need!
customer_reviews.text: Top shelf labeler. Will do way more than you will ever buy it for! If there’s a better one made, I’d have to see it myself! Not cheap and definitely not of poor quality. Worth it! No one ever bought high quality and regretted it!!!
customer_reviews.author: TB

customer_reviews.title: Eats Batteries when turned off!
customer_reviews.text: I love this Label printer! I would've given it better reviews but it will eat your batteries even if the device is off. I left it off for a week and when I went to use it again batteries were completely drained. I have went through over 30 batteries since I purchased this back in late 2018.
customer_reviews.author: Warfaire

customer_reviews.title: great label printer
customer_reviews.text: wide labels are much easier to read, you can pick the font style and size or just set it to auto size. Its a little pricey but produces great labels that stay stuck on whatever you put them on!
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: If you need a little maker this is the way ...
customer_reviews.text: If you need a little maker this is the way to go, the quality of the labels and the fact that you can do multiple line entries on the same label is priceless. I'm feeling if you use this a lot you may want to get rechargeable batteries for it as I do find if you have the backlight display on it will go through batteries quickly.
customer_reviews.author: M. A. H

customer_reviews.title: Great label maker, wish it had qwerty keyboard!
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used my label maker too much yet, but it seems to be really good. The only drawback, or minus I should say, is the keyboard not being qwerty. It's not too big of a deal, but given how almost all keyboards are qwerty, I do find myself having to look around for the next letter in the word I'm trying to print.
customer_reviews.author: Phil C.

customer_reviews.title: Wastes batteries
customer_reviews.text: It keeps turning itself on in my bag, so every time I've needed it, the batteries have been dead.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua L.

customer_reviews.title: Good for my purpose
customer_reviews.text: This is great, not just for wire labels. I am using wherever I need a fairly permanent label. Especially on small objects like flash drives. It also has a very manly heft to it. Don't drop it on your foot. The lost star is due to the warning not to use lithium batteries. Due my problems with leakage, I take the alkaline batteries out between uses. (I don't use it very often or I would buy Brady's rechargeable pack).
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Enjoy the Printer - but they need to update the ...
customer_reviews.text: Enjoy the Printer - but they need to update the manufacture description...it states in the there a Lithium-Ion Battery...no batter came with it...it does say 6 alkaline batteries will run it in the Amazon description, but it is misleading
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Needs tweaking / better options
customer_reviews.text: Having some issues with the barcode readability that Brady can't duplicate. Would like to be able to compress the barcode as it spits out about a 3" strip for a 4-5 character barcode. We only need a 1.5" strip for our purpose and have to manually trim it down. wastes tape. Need the ability to have other codes other than 39 & 128 as options. Should be able to barcode on a 1/2 " cartridge. (must use min 3/4). Customer service part was very good though, I didn't feel very confident when talking to the Tech support person.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: NO BATTERY INCLUDED!
customer_reviews.text: Great label maker but DOES NOT COME WITH BATTERY AS STATED!! Called factory and they would not send a battery.
customer_reviews.author: Midwest Sparky

customer_reviews.title: Very good label printer
customer_reviews.text: This label maker is very well built and will tolerate being tossed in your tool bag. The variety of label types, fonts, directions and more make this ideal for most label printing tasks. This purchase is a replacement for an older model. Both are great!
customer_reviews.author: Chuck Clovis

customer_reviews.title: Printer jams and drains batteries!
customer_reviews.text: Printer jams constantly and battery die with each use. Constantly drains batteries without even using the printer. Want to return for better printer but seller won't allow returns.
customer_reviews.author: Handsome Guy

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Very nice unit! Easy to use. Bought the external power supply so I don’t know about battery life.
customer_reviews.author: DPM

customer_reviews.title: Great little printer for field use
customer_reviews.text: I do wish some of the cartridge types were a little cheaper, but these really are perfect for field use wire marker placement or just anything you need to print and not be tied down to a power cord. We have 2 and used them to print out every single wire marker on 20 panels...and batteries are still going. No degradation of any kind so they actually do hold up for everyday use.
customer_reviews.author: TK

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Labels stay on. Love the self laminating cable labels. Very durable.
customer_reviews.author: Kadir

customer_reviews.title: Works good
customer_reviews.text: A little complicated to use keep the instructions close by but it prints good quality labels
customer_reviews.author: Tom Wedding

customer_reviews.title: I wanted an easy way to label the wires on the back of ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a professional electrician, just an average guy with a touch of OCD. I wanted an easy way to label the wires on the back of my computer and tv/sound system, and this works like a charm. My wife even borrowed it to label some of her things.
customer_reviews.author: Bob in Austin

customer_reviews.title: Great labeler
customer_reviews.text: Really nice label maker. Top of the line quality. Very versatile for different labeling needs. Great buy
customer_reviews.author: Nathan K.

customer_reviews.title: It was definitely a great tool so I bought the PLUS for my home ...
customer_reviews.text: I had a BMP21 working with a Laser company. It was definitely a great tool so I bought the PLUS for my home project use. Great tool, user friendly, I'm building my house as I go so this maybe a little overboard but labeling my electric, phone, cable, Ethernet and so on really helps keeping things straight. You may not get to work on it for a while so it is definitely easy to have these labels on the cables, helps you jump back in the game without delay of re tracking what goes where. The Brady BMP21-PLUS has an honest price and I feel at this time is very durable and user friendly.
customer_reviews.author: Triple Nickel Farm

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Still working just like new. Very happy with the purchase. Recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Nicolae

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Really useful for a mildly OCD DIYer. So far I have used it to label the electrical and water lines in the basement of our 100 year old house, which has been a great help in understanding what a succession of previous owners have done (sometimes badly), and to label parts drawers in my workshop. Very easy to use, although I haven't explored all the functions. Only slight niggle is the keyboard - QWERTY would be better, but this may not be a niggle for those working mainly with numerical/symbol labels.
customer_reviews.author: James Bruce

customer_reviews.title: Works awesome
customer_reviews.text: Great working product for labeling wires in the eletric field.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Reliable workhorse on a budget
customer_reviews.text: The top of the line for portable handheld labellers.easy to peel labels,bold image,a Ton of options.my whole work team owns them as a standard.label carts easy to replace and don't jam.brady has always been the superior product for wire labellers,and this is affordable and reliable.wont let you down.had a rhino briefly and it was a pain in the ass in too many ways to list .
customer_reviews.author: Tommy

customer_reviews.title: Liked it so much I bought a second one
customer_reviews.text: Bought one for work and everyone liked it so much that I purchased a second one for another department that kept borrowing mine. Rugged construction and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: J Buxton

customer_reviews.title: Fast, Super Fast ship, Great product, Great price, I'm happy
customer_reviews.text: Would have been nice if it came with the A/C cord, but it is what it is!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Hawkeye

customer_reviews.title: This is a very nice label maker
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice label maker. It was more than I expected, both in design and size. It's a fairly large unit and is really designed for commercial and work environments. That said, it is an awesome piece for the house as well. You might be able to spend less on a residential unit though. If you are looking for a contractor grade piece of equipment, this is definitely the unit.
customer_reviews.author: Guy

customer_reviews.title: Terrible product - failed in a few months
customer_reviews.text: Thought this would be a high quality, durable product. I only used it to make one label and it completely killed a new set of batteries while turned off in a few months. Went to use a second time, changed the batteries and now it won't turn on at all. Total piece of junk!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: OUTSTANDING PRODUCT!
customer_reviews.text: This Brady Labeler is AWESOME! Do not waste your time on another lesser priced system! No write-on or template systems. This Brady is in a league by itself. The quality, flexibility of options, construction and application of the various label stocks is awesome. You can find so many more uses for this labeler as well.
customer_reviews.author: PJ / San Diego

customer_reviews.title: Great tool with great tape - wish was QWERTY keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Great tool with great tape - wish was QWERTY keyboard
customer_reviews.author: Erkle

customer_reviews.title: A good value for marking wires
customer_reviews.text: A good value for marking wires a must for large wire looms
customer_reviews.author: ultra rider

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: I am now retired, but I used Brady label makers for many years as an industrial electrician. We tried many other brands in our shop, but Brady is by far the best. Now have one of my own for home projects. Only con I can think of is that the tapes are somewhat pricey.
customer_reviews.author: tigerseye

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 20 uses. No recourse after 2 years. Broke 50 months after purchase from Amazon
customer_reviews.text: Broke after 20 labels. Company said had to buy new one. Now I have expensive cartridges and no machine. Have to buy another. Rarely used but rapidly broke.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn Tisman

customer_reviews.title: Solid, dependable labeler...
customer_reviews.text: Solid labeler. We provide these to all of our technicians. Perfect for labeling cables, devices, panels, etc...
customer_reviews.author: The Adam Bomb

customer_reviews.title: 10/10 would buy again
customer_reviews.text: Intuitive, plenty of options & symbols, durable, doesn't waste too much tape with the margins, and the nylon tape is great (looks great, sticks great). If anything, it would be cool to upload your own symbols via a micro USB or something, but for what most people need, this is the whole package.
customer_reviews.author: Lewis Spring

customer_reviews.title: Very versatile and sturdy labeler
customer_reviews.text: I really, really wish I had bought this a few years ago. This is a very versatile labeler, and well worth the cost. I've been labeling cables and other items like a maniac for weeks. Very useful if you do any kind of wiring, or have cables which need to be removed regularly.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew S. Baker

customer_reviews.title: BMP21
customer_reviews.text: this is a Brady label maker, easy to use, tough, durable and versatile
customer_reviews.author: robert j oneil jr

customer_reviews.title: Great portable handheld label maker for tough jobs
customer_reviews.text: Great portable handheld label maker for tough jobs. We used it to label storage bins and audio & camera cables. It gets the job done and It takes the hassle out of sorting through multiple cables to find the correct one.
customer_reviews.author: Jose Jimenez

customer_reviews.title: This product has had trouble printing from day 1
customer_reviews.text: I finally got the label maker to print. But after I got it to print, it was not doing it anymore. I have pulled the tape through but it still wont print. Also there is no way to return this - I am $100 out of money and no way to get this product to work reliably.
customer_reviews.author: Muneeza Akhtar

customer_reviews.title: Durable
customer_reviews.text: Very high doller lable maker. Works like a charm and comes with one pack of lables!
customer_reviews.author: Blaze

customer_reviews.title: love it.
customer_reviews.text: By far my favorite label maker. Tons of label types available. I have been using them for about 8 years to label wires for my job. Now that I left that sector, I bought my one for my personal tool collection.
customer_reviews.author: nimda

customer_reviews.title: If you need a label printer, this is probably the one you need
customer_reviews.text: This thing is really great for any IT department that wants to be able to label cables, patch panels or anything, really. Does barcodes too. There are many cartridges to fit just about any situation. The only thing that would make this thing better, is if it had a USB port that you could use to batch print from a PC.
customer_reviews.author: wRx7M

customer_reviews.title: Seller is AWESOME!!
customer_reviews.text: Seller is AWESOME!!! I use this label maker at work (I'm a commercial electrician). This is a rugged very versatile label maker that takes a lot of abuse. I decided I wanted my own for home, so when I saw an open box special from SalesChamp on Amazon I jumped at it. Box/hard plastic wrapper was cut open at top but label maker was in PERFECT condition!!! I got a GREAT DEAL but as always beware of buying open box items.... Seller shipped item right away and I am very pleased with product and retailer.
customer_reviews.author: J. D. Stabb

customer_reviews.title: Create your own label for this spot!
customer_reviews.text: I've used these labelers for a few years now with multiple jobs, and love them. Comes with a 3/4" tape. Requires 6, AA batteries or the battery accessory.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan P.

customer_reviews.title: A must have!
customer_reviews.text: Every cable in a datacenter should be labeled, this is the perfect tool.
customer_reviews.author: Eddy Caballero

customer_reviews.title: Brady BMP21-PLUS
customer_reviews.text: This thing is good. Cartridges are a little pricey but then the unit seems priced low. Check out the youtube video's from manufacturer. Would recommend checking out thee kit for the extra $80+ you get the battery which is well worth it as you have to use high quality AA to support the power draw.
customer_reviews.author: Wobzo

customer_reviews.title: Great Device! Cartridges expensive $21+ each
customer_reviews.text: Great device!!! Get ready to PAY for the cartridges, $21+!!! Takes a while to get used to functions. Instructions don't explain much AT ALL!!! YouTube helps tremendously!!! Brady Website OK, could have MORE USER VIDEOS!!!
customer_reviews.author: CarWashGuru

customer_reviews.title: Husband loved this. Upgrade from his older model same brand
customer_reviews.text: Husband loved this. Upgrade from his older model same brand. And the cartridges fit from the old one in this one.
customer_reviews.author: jaime

customer_reviews.title: good label maker
customer_reviews.text: This is a useful gadget for hobbyists and pros. The only caveat is that there are accessories that you probably want that are additional purchases. This only has a battery compartment. A rechargeable battery is available and so is a wall-wart adapter. This does consume much power, but I use standard AA batteries and it is OK for light use. For heavy use go to the rechargeable power pack.
customer_reviews.author: Lee M Downey

customer_reviews.title: You WANT one of these!
customer_reviews.text: If you do any kind of electrical work where you have to label your network cables, this one gets the job done. Liked it so much, I bought a spare. You'll wonder how you ever worked without one.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Emmert

customer_reviews.title: High Quality Label Printer
customer_reviews.text: The Brady BMP21-Plus is a very nice label printer. Seems to be well designed and constructed. The labels it prints out are superb. The user manual downloaded from the Brady web site was extremely helpful.
customer_reviews.author: OHBob

customer_reviews.title: Great for electrical projects or general organization.
customer_reviews.text: Best basic labeler I've found. I put it in an Apache hard case that I bought on sale at Harbor Freight.
customer_reviews.author: NomersMcBorg

customer_reviews.title: Warranty issue..... Replacement request
customer_reviews.text: This Brady label maker has randomly stopped working in the middle of printing, it just started printing nothing but solid black on the sticker. This was after switching label cartridges to make sure the cartridge wasn't the issue. Is there a warranty replacement for this item? We have only had this since December 2016. It should not have
customer_reviews.author: Sandy W.

customer_reviews.title: Ask for a case of batteries with it.
customer_reviews.text: To make the batteries last, you have to remove at least one when not in use or you will be replacing 6 batteries soon.
customer_reviews.author: Amtek, Inc

customer_reviews.title: NO  User Manual
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this label maker a month ago for a project, just opened it and there is no users manual I am wasting tape trying to figure it out,I am getting very irritated with it.
customer_reviews.author: James Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Brady BMP21-PLUS Handheld label printer
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly. I love it! I use it for making labels for bottles of spices. I can see that it can be used for many other purposes as well.
customer_reviews.author: Big D

customer_reviews.title: Stock up on batteries
customer_reviews.text: I use these machines at work and they are great. This one eats batteries, I will print 5-6 wire markers with new batteries; come back a week later and it is just about dead! I have used 24 batteries in 2 months and only used about a 1/4 roll of tape
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Nice label maker
customer_reviews.text: I love it, I mainly use the self laminating labels for cables at work. No problems with this unit. Labels are a bit expensive but I believe in the pay for what you get idea. The rubber bumpers are nice. I would suggest getting the Brady case with it.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for network and systems admins
customer_reviews.text: Durable and easy to hold, this label maker is perfect for me. I use it almost daily to label Cat 5e/6, patch panels, and switched. Labeled all wires and components in a Dell rack recently and the entire setup looks very professional. If I had a need for two I would buy another one.
customer_reviews.author: JohnDball-dot-com

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use and very much what I expected.
customer_reviews.author: Virgil J Salem

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for an electrician, plumber, HVAC, Controls, and any other tradesman, or craftswoman.
customer_reviews.text: SO MANY OPTIONS!!! This labeler is top notch and prints smoothly is quite cuts cleanly, soft squishy buttons, user friendly. Frankly the printer does everything the manual says it does. There are many color options for ribbons and they fit nicely into the holder.
customer_reviews.author: Jason M. Eiting

customer_reviews.title: Great label maker
customer_reviews.text: This label maker is easy to use and makes great labels. The quality of print is excellent. Labels cut easily and there is no waste of label tape. I plan on purchasing several sizes of label tape because the cartridges are easy to remove and install.
customer_reviews.author: ddcced

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommended
customer_reviews.text: EXCELLENT label maker. I use this label maker daily for labeling cables and other things. Many different settings on this label maker and I also really treasure the illuminated screen. Upgraded from the regular bmp21 and am definitely happy to have this label printer. Highly recommended to anyone who uses a label printer on a regular basis.
customer_reviews.author: Cameron Graves

customer_reviews.title: But the label maker itself is wonderful.
customer_reviews.text: I ended up returning it and getting the one that has a case, battery, power cord, etc. But the label maker itself is wonderful.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Standard of quality
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality. Durable and user friendly. Definitely the industry standard for my profession.
customer_reviews.author: RDT

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Awesome unit. Well worth the money. Cartridges are expensive, but looking professional costs money. Would repurchase. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Cody Groen

customer_reviews.title: No comparison to my Brother - this is the label maker to get
customer_reviews.text: If you're trying to use a Brother to make labels for ethernet cables, throw it away and buy this. Much better quality. Feels like it will last forever.
customer_reviews.author: Photoshop Wannabe

customer_reviews.title: Working good. Cant leave the batteries in even when it ...
customer_reviews.text: Working good. Cant leave the batteries in even when it is powered off because it will drain them so one star off.
customer_reviews.author: chobbes

customer_reviews.title: VERY dissapointing for longer labels. Hard to use. Wast of time and money.
customer_reviews.text: Initially I was using this for wiring and circuit breakers, works great for short labels. Then I wanted to make a longer label in large type - easy right? No. This unit allows you to enter the text then errors out saying its too big and deletes all your data entered. Yes I tried setting the label type. This unit is hard to use, confusing and has a very terrible user interface. If you have a single purpose for this like wires it is probably OK. If you want to label a variety of other things - this unit falls very short. It now sits in a drawer because it is so useless.
customer_reviews.author: JoeVolcano

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: It works great but the ac adapter is far to expensive.
customer_reviews.author: seabumb

customer_reviews.title: but if you are a label freak like me then this is indispensable
customer_reviews.text: Expensive, but if you are a label freak like me then this is indispensable. I'm an IT professional and really appreciate quality cable labels - labels that can be read, and don't peel after a year. This really hits the spot.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Great labeler system
customer_reviews.text: Great labeler system, I should have bought this sooner. I particularly like the self-laminating wire labels, clean look and seem to flex with the cable instead of creasing or bunching up. Lots of color label options too.
customer_reviews.author: Some guy on the Internet

customer_reviews.title: Impressive features, definitely for specialized use
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy this if you need regular labels. This is high tech and difficult to you for anything other than specialized plant or mechanical parts labeling
customer_reviews.author: field user

customer_reviews.title: DOA
customer_reviews.text: Printer DOA. You'd think quality control would catch this. I have three of these at my business and have never had any issue. Had to go to Staples to get one to avoid downtime.
customer_reviews.author: eric menard

customer_reviews.title: I really like this labeler
customer_reviews.text: I really like this labeler. Fits nicely in your hand so you can type while you hold it. Seems rugged. Prints cable labels as well as regular labels.
customer_reviews.author: bford

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer
customer_reviews.text: Really Great Printer, for both wire marking and panel markings.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph

customer_reviews.title: nice, go anywhere labeler
customer_reviews.text: Very, very, nice, go anywhere labeler! I highly recommend this bradley labeler!
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: best label printer for a IT professional ! Perfect cable labels and so easy to use!
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Bishop

product_meta.title: Brady BMP21-PLUS Handheld Label Printer with Rubber Bumpers, Multi-Line Print, 6 to 40 Point Font
product_meta.description: Brady BMP21-PLUS Label Printer is tough on the outside and smart on the inside. BMP21-PLUS has ultra rugged construction and world class materials combined in a toolbox-ready fit-in-your-palm label printer that produces continuous-only labels up to 3/4" wide. Choose from 70 label parts across 8 incredibly durable materials including self-laminating wire markers, heat-shrink wire sleeves, cable flags, 8-to-10-year outdoor vinyl, nylon cloth wire and panel labels, terminal block and patch panel labels, and chemical-resistant polyester and polypropylene. When it comes to durability, the BMP21-PLUS has heavy-duty molded-rubber impact bumpers and an optional hard carry case, and it has been drop-tested to MIL drop-test standards. Industry-specific features include backlit display for low-light work areas, one-touch setup for aire, flagging, T-block, patchpanel and breaker box apps, and 125 symbols for electrical, datacom, A/V, smart home and safety. Unique features include a built-in label grabber device that prevents your cut label from falling to the ground after it's cut, one-handed label cut operation, and an optional magnet accessory for mounting the printer to a metal panel or surface for hands-free operation. Operates on (6) AA batteries, optional rechargeable Li-ION battery, or optional AC adapter. 2 year included.
feature_bullets: Handheld printer with keyboard creates multi line labels for clear identification of wires, panels, circuit boards, and other industrial items, and has a tough exterior with molded rubber bumpers for impact resistance
Keyboard contains letters A to Z and numbers 0 to 9, and the text displays on the LCD screen as it is typed
Text prints in a single color and in 6 font sizes (6 to 40 point)
Continuous tape cartridges (sold separately) enable labels of varying widths
Six AA alkaline batteries power the printer for portability

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.
